The GBN Kids 4 the Cure Club is known for its efforts to raise cancer awareness. The students are driven by their desire to make a difference in the lives of others.

This winter, the club partnered with an organization called Special Spaces, where they spent a full day remodeling the bedroom of a teen who was returning home after undergoing treatment for leukemia. The initiative took months of planning and fundraising from the students involved.

All their hard work and dedication paid off when they witnessed the young girl and her family reacts to the new living space. Even better, there were enough funds left to redesign her little brother's bedroom as well, because this battle has been hard on the entire family.

#GBNNow

Heartland Animal Shelter
October 18, 2017 at 8:00 AM · Northbrook, IL ·

We were thrilled to meet with Ms. Rogers and the many bright and kindhearted students who are part of Glenbrook North High School’s PAWS club! Our partnership with the club has helped raise awareness of the shelter and the many animals waiting for their forever homes.

Two large bulletin boards are displayed in the halls of the high school showcasing Heartland’s adoptable animals.

The PAWS club is open to all students passionate about animal welfare. They focus on raising school and community awareness about animal cruelty, helping homeless pets and supporting wildlife conservation.

Thank you for all you do, GBN!
